Introducing "Spotware talks" panel discussion series

Summary

TH

EN

The article introduces the "Spotware talks" panel series featuring interviews from the FMLS:25 summit. Dor Eligula of BridgeWise discusses the integration of AI in investment research, highlighting "blue ocean" growth opportunities in Asian markets and the critical balance between automation and human oversight to prevent errors. Additionally, Brendan Callan, CEO of TRADU, shares his perspective after winning a debate on the prop trading industry, criticizing the current model for its over-reliance on fees, loose risk management, and confusing nature for retail clients.

Key Points

  • Dor Eligula discusses AI integration in investment research and growth in Asian markets.
  • Brendan Callan argues against the current Prop Trading model, citing fee dependence and risk issues.
  • The "Spotware talks" series features executive insights from the FMLS:25 summit.

Article

Executive Interview | Dor Eligula | Co-Founder & Chief Business Officer, BridgeWise | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Dor Eligula | Co-Founder & Chief Business Officer, BridgeWise | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Dor Eligula | Co-Founder & Chief Business Officer, BridgeWise | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Dor Eligula | Co-Founder & Chief Business Officer, BridgeWise | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Dor Eligula | Co-Founder & Chief Business Officer, BridgeWise | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Dor Eligula | Co-Founder & Chief Business Officer, BridgeWise | FMLS:25 In this session, Jonathan Fine form Ultimate Group speaks with Dor Eligula from Bridgewise, a fast-growing AI-powered research and analytics firm supporting brokers and exchanges worldwide. We start with Dor‚Äôs reaction to the Summit and then move to broker growth and the quick wins brokers often overlook. Dor shares where he sees ‚Äúblue ocean‚Äù growth across Asian markets and how local client behaviour shapes demand. We also discuss the rollout of AI across investment research. Dor gives real examples of how automation and human judgment meet at Bridgewise ‚Äî including moments when analysts corrected AI output, and times when AI prevented an error. We close with a practical question: how retail investors can actually use AI without falling into common traps. Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Executive Interview | Brendan Callan | CEO, TRADU | FMLS:25 Brendan Callan joined us fresh off the Summit‚Äôs most anticipated debate: ‚ÄúIs Prop Trading Good for the Industry?‚Äù Brendan argued against the motion ‚Äî and the audience voted him the winner. In this interview, Brendan explains the reasoning behind his position. He walks through the message he believes many firms avoid: that the current prop trading model is too dependent on fees, too loose on risk, and too confusing for retail audiences. We discuss why he thinks the model grew fast, why it may run into walls, and what he believes is needed for a cleaner, more responsible version of prop trading. This is Brendan at his frankest ‚Äî sharp, grounded, and very clear about what changes are overdue. broker operating since 2016, offering access to multiple trading platforms, over 1,000 instruments, and flexible account types for different trading styles. We break down Blueberry‚Äôs regulatory structure, including its Australian Financial Services License (AFSL), as well as its authorisation and registrations in other jurisdictions. The review also covers supported platforms such as MetaTrader 4, MetaTrader 5, cTrader, TradingView, Blueberry.X, and web-based trading. You‚Äôll learn about available instruments across forex, commodities, indices, share CFDs, and crypto CFDs, along with leverage options, minimum and maximum trade sizes, and how Blueberry structures its Standard and Raw accounts. We also explain spreads, commissions, swap rates, swap-free account availability, funding and withdrawal methods, processing times, and what traders can expect from customer support and additional services.
